Catching Up on the WordPress & WP Engine Situation â€” Thereâ€™s been plenty of continued drama in the WordPress world between Automattic and WP Engine â€”Â and this post attempts to bring us up to speed. More has happened since including â–¶ï¸ Matt Mullenweg sitting down with Theo Browne for a chat about the situation, and some new terms have beenÂ shared.

Geoff Graham

The HTTP QUERY Method â€” A draft spec for a new QUERY HTTP method, a â€œsafe, idempotent request method that can carry request contentâ€. Itâ€™s said to be desirable â€œwhen the data conveyed in a request is too voluminous to be encoded into the requestâ€™sÂ URIâ€. It's not quite GET, but it's not quiteÂ POST..

Reschke, Malhotra, Snell, Bishop

Build a Native App Experience with PWAs â€” Join Maximiliano Firtman for a detailed video course exploring how to create installable, offline-capable web apps. You'll learn how to create impressive Progressive Web Apps, explore various UI techniques, dig into how best to test and debug, and how to deploy your efforts to endÂ users.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Web Components Are Okay â€” Spent any time on social this week? You may have spotted many in the frontend community talking about and questioning the overall merit and utility of Web Components. Nolan ties a few of these arguments together, concluding that folks are generally â€œtalking past each other because theyâ€™re building different things with differentÂ constraintsâ€.

Nolan Lawson

CSS Masonry & CSS Grid â€” As mentioned last week, steam is picking up on a formal CSS solution for masonry layouts, but with two competing proposals and lots of various opinions on both flying around, itâ€™s good to take a high-level overview of where things stand â€” thatâ€™s what thisÂ is.

Preethi Sam

â–¶Â Â Fundamentals of Frontend Architecture â€” A free video course that covers â€œeverything you need to know to build robust and scalable frontend applicationsâ€. It covers architectural drivers, documentation, decision making, prototyping, implementation, andÂ more.

Maxi Ferreira

OctoPalm.js: A Lightweight JavaScript Utility to Add Customizable Search Functionality to Your Apps â€” Includes features like animated results, customizable scrollbars for lengthy search lists, and real-time results as the userÂ types.

TinyJS: A Lightweight Library to Easily Generate and Customize DOM Elements â€” Includes a jQuery-like syntax for element selection, iteration, and appending content and adding properties to elements. Nothing you couldnâ€™t do with vanilla JS, but a much simplerÂ API.

items.content:
ğŸš€ Frontend Focus

#â€‹661 â€” September 25, 2024 | Read on the web

The First Public Working Draft of CSS Grid Level 3 / Masonry Layout â€” This new draft represents progress on masonry layout as a built-in capability of CSS in two possible syntactic forms: a grid-integrated syntax, and a grid-independent syntax, both outlined asÂ alternatives. The CSSWG has resolved to adopt fully mixed track sizing for this new layout model, allowing all the possible track listings expressible in CSS Grid for masonry layouts too.

W3C

â–¶Â Â CSS Masonry Layouts â€” As weâ€™ve covered in recent months (and as alluded to above) thereâ€™s differing, strong opinions on how best masonry layouts should finally be realised in CSS. Nicole does a good job of bringing us up to speed on the various sides both clearly andÂ fairly.

Nicole Sullivan

ğŸ’¬ Related: Rachel Andrew makes the case for a separate display: masonry value.

How To Make Your Web Page Faster Before It Even Loads â€” What about the events that happen before the first byte of a web page is received by the browser? Read from Salma Alam-Naylor, how to measure those events and optimize them to make web pages and applications load evenÂ faster.

Bramus Van Damme

DECK.GL: GPU-Powered Large-Scale Data Visualization Framework â€” Particularly well suited to geospatial data visualization use cases that go beyond typical 2D views. There are plenty of examples to show you what it can do. Can be used through both vanilla JS and ReactÂ interfaces.

(LGPL licensed with a 'pro'Â option.)
